examples: The two men swindled the company out of $160,000.

definitions.definition: To obtain ( money or property ) by fraudulent or deceitful methods .
examples: She swindled more than £200 out of me.

definitions.definition: For a player in a losing position to play a clever move that provokes an error from the opponent, thus achieving a win or a draw .

secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive ) To obtain ( money or property ) by fraudulent or deceitful methods .
( chess ) For a player in a losing position to play a clever move that provokes an error from the opponent, thus achieving a win or a draw .
